text:
After being disappointed and fed up of the way police handled her case, actress Kate Sharma has reportedly withdrawn her sexual harassment case against Bollywood filmmaker Subhash Ghai. In a conversation with news agency ANI, Kate had said,
Agencies
“He called me at his house on August 6. 5-6 people were present there, he asked me to give him a massage. I massaged him and went to wash my hands, he followed me, called me to his room to talk and tried to kiss me.”
Actor Kate Sharma files police complaint against filmmaker Subhash Ghai; says, 'he called me at his house on August 6. 5-6 ppl were present there,he asked me to give him massage.I massaged him&went to wash my hands,he followed me, called me to his room to talk & tried to kiss me' pic.twitter.com/TiJm9EADCy — ANI (@ANI) October 13, 2018
And now confirming the news of withdrawing the case, she was quoted in a Mid-day report as saying,
Twitter
“Yes, I have informed the Mumbai police that I want to withdraw my complaint against Subhash Ghai. I want to take care of my family and my ailing mother instead of roaming here and there to get justice for whatever has happened to me.”
She went on to explain how #MeToo movement has failed to work in a country like India, where victims are intimated and mocked. She said,

“People are really making fun of the entire #MeToo campaign. Nothing has happened, nobody has been arrested. If cops are only busy registering FIRs, then what is the use of this entire campaign? Tell me, how many people have been arrested? Cops asked me if I wanted to register an FIR, but I don’t see any reason for moving ahead to get justice as whatever I had to say is in the public domain. We (Ghai and her) were very good friends, but he destroyed everything; I’ve said this publicly and I’m saying it again. I am fed up of everything, hence I have withdrawn my case.”
title: Citing How #MeToo Movement Failed, Kate Sharma Withdraws Harassment Case Against Subhash Ghai
